claim: A Twitter post claimed Cristiano Ronaldo is transforming his string of hotels to hospitals to aid in the fight against COVID-19.
explanation: A spokesperson from the hotel denied the claim and there is no such statement present on any of the footballer’s media accounts.

claim: Cristiano Ronaldo will convert his hotels into coronavirus hospitals.
explanation: A spokesperson for the hotels said the claim was “inaccurate." Ronaldo has not mentioned any such plan on his social media platforms.

claim: Claim that football star Cristiano Ronaldo has converted his hotel chain into coronavirus hospitals.
explanation: A spokesman for Cristiano Ronaldo’s hotel chain, the Pestana CR7, denied the report by sports newspaper Marca. Marca deleted the original report and social media posts. Ronaldo has not publicly commented on the report.

claim: The Portuguese soccer player Cristiano Ronaldo decided to turn his hotels into free hospitals
explanation: Cristiano Ronaldo has never decide to turn his hotels in to free hospitals.

claim: Cristiano Ronaldo is going to transform his hotels into hospitals.
explanation: The claim about the Portuguese football player is not true, sources close to the hotels and the player confirmed.

claim: The Italian medical sector is angry at Ronaldo.
explanation: The first claim deals with attributing a tweet to a Spanish biology researcher who blames her government for the poor salary biologists receive, while the second claim deals with the content of the tweet itself that Cristiano Ronaldo receives one million euros, unlike doctors who receive 1,300 euros per month. The news is misleading.

claim: Ronaldo Bought an island to isolate himself from coronavirus.
explanation: Misbar confirmed the news is false. Cristiano Ronaldo did not buy an island to isolate him. After suspending the Series A matches due to the outbreak of COVID-19, he returned to the Portuguese island of Madeira, his hometown in the Atlantic Ocean.

claim: Cristiano Ronaldo transformed some of his hotels into hospitals to fight COVID-19.
explanation: Cristiano Ronaldo refuted those claims.

claim: Cristiano Ronaldo will convert his hotels into coronavirus hospitals.
explanation: A spokesperson for the hotels said the claim was “inaccurate." Ronaldo has also not mentioned any such plan on his social media platforms.

claim: Cristiano Ronaldo will turn his hotels into hospitals.
explanation: Information was published without verification and denied.

claim: Cristiano Ronaldo transformed his hotels into hospitals for COVID-19 patients.
explanation: Cristiano Ronaldo did not say this and is not planning to do this.

claim: Footballer Ronaldo is turning his hotels into COVID-19 hospitals.
explanation: There is no evidence that Ronaldo's luxury hotels in Portugal are being turned into hospitals.

claim: Cristiano Ronaldo turned his hotels into hospitals.
explanation: The claim is false.

claim: Cristiano Ronaldo is turning his hotels into hospitals to fight coronavirus.
explanation: Ronaldo's management company denied the claim.

claim: The Portuguese soccer player Cristiano Ronaldo decided to turn his hotels into free hospitals
explanation: This claim is false.

claim: Cristiano Ronaldo's hotels to be turned into quarantine centres in Portugal.
explanation: Footballer's hotel chains denied the claim.

claim: Cristiano Ronaldo donated his hotel to be turned into an hospital.
explanation: Ronaldo did not announce this and his partners denied it.

claim: Cristiano Ronaldo turns hotel into hospital for coronavirus.
explanation: The manager of the hotel owned by Ronaldo has denied the rumors and stated that the hotel  will remain a hotel.

claim: A "Spanish biological researcher" says "You give the footballer 1 million euros a month and a biological researcher 1,800 euros per month, and you are now looking for a coronavirus treatment. Go to Cristiano Ronaldo or Messi and they will get you a cure." A quote published with a photo of this so-called "Spanish biological researcher."
explanation: The woman in the photograph is not a Spanish biologist researcher, but Isabel Garcia Tejerina, an ex Spanish minister. The photo was taken during an interview in 2018, long before the outbreak of coronavirus.

claim: Cristiano Ronaldo will convert his hotels into coronavirus hospitals.
explanation: The claim is false; a spokesperson for the hotels said the claim was “inaccurate”; Ronaldo has also not mentioned any such plan on his social media platforms.

claim: Spanish scientist (and former minister for agriculture) says that people should go to Ronaldo or Messi for the cure, as they are better paid.
explanation: It's a meme. The former Spanish minister for agriculture never said this.

claim: Cristiano Ronaldo bought private island to escape coronavirus.
explanation: Ronaldo's management company confirmed it was false.

claim: An image shows a Spanish scientist asking Cristiano Ronaldo and Messi to find the cure for COVID-19.
explanation: The woman in the picture is not a scientist, but an ex-member of previous Spanish governments. It was taken in April 2008 and was never related to the new coronavirus or to the football players.

claim: Cristiano Ronaldo converts hotels to coronavirus hospitals.
source: Danish website quoting Swedish tabloid, Twitter posts
explanation: A spokesman for the 35-year-old football player's hotel, Pestana CR7, says the news is false.

claim: Posts on social media claim that a “Spanish biological researcher” called on international soccer stars Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi to find a cure for COVID-19 since they earn much more money than scientists.
explanation: The accompanying photo shows a Spanish politician speaking in April 2018, well before the novel coronavirus outbreak.
